alert.note: Alert for Baxter; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Marion; Searcy County Lower Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 6:03PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Searcy, southeastern Marion and central Baxter Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 603 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rush to near Maumee to near Duff. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mountain Home... Marshall... Yellville... Gassville... Norfork... Salesville... Briarcliff... Norfork Dam... Shipp... Herron... Maumee... Rush... Lion Hill... Advance... Cartney... Culp... Colfax... Cotter... Big Flat... Zach... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for north central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Baxter; Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Marion; Searcy County Lower Elevations
